calculate the percent of TFs that are annotated to a GO term for which their

text: terms data.frame obtained calling get_terms folder summaries output webgestalt_network organism string specifying organism data , e.g. "hsapiens" "scerevisiae" go_ann data.frame annotations genes GO terms. Obtain WebGestaltR::loadGeneSet. go_reg data.frame regulatory relationships GO terms. Obtain ontologyIndex::get_ontology.

title: get_metrics — get_metrics
text: Get data.frame contains specified metrics networks subdirectory provided path including real permuted networks. path contain directories created webgestalt_network.

title: get_metrics — get_metrics
code: get_metrics(   directory,   organism = "hsapiens",   get_sum = TRUE,   get_percent = FALSE,   get_mean = FALSE,   get_median = FALSE,   get_annotation_overlap = FALSE,   parallel = TRUE )

title: get_metrics — get_metrics
text: directory directory containing webgestalt_network output directory network interest organism string specifying organism data , e.g. "hsapiens" "scerevisiae". specify get_annotation_overlap = TRUE. get_sum bool whether get 'sum' metric, sum negative log base 10 p-value top term TF minus 3 times total number TFs. get_percent bool whether get 'percent' metric, percent TFs least one GO term FDR < 0.05 get_mean bool whether get 'mean' metric, mean negative log base 10 p-value top term TF get_median bool whether get 'median' metric, median negative log base 10 p-value top term TF get_annotation_overlap bool whether get 'annotation_overlap' metric, percent TFs annotated GO term target genes enriched parallel bool whether get metrics network directory parallel sequentially

what:
helper function to compute the desired metrics from a dataframe of the top
terms for each TF in a single network — get_network_metrics
title:
helper function to compute the desired metrics from a dataframe of the top
terms for each TF in a single network — get_network_metrics
text: helper function compute desired metrics dataframe top terms TF single network

title:
helper function to compute the desired metrics from a dataframe of the top
terms for each TF in a single network — get_network_metrics
code: get_network_metrics(   full_terms,   network_size,   organism,   get_sum,   get_percent,   get_mean,   get_median,   get_annotation_overlap,   go_ann = NULL,   go_reg = NULL )

title:
helper function to compute the desired metrics from a dataframe of the top
terms for each TF in a single network — get_network_metrics
text: full_terms data.frame containing summary results network. Use get_terms obtain. network_size number TFs network. May different number TFs summary files. organism string specifying organism data , e.g. "hsapiens" "scerevisiae". specify get_annotation_overlap = TRUE. get_sum bool whether get 'sum' metric, sum negative log base 10 p-value top term TF minus 3 times total number TFs. get_percent bool whether get 'percent' metric, percent TFs least one GO term FDR < 0.05 get_mean bool whether get 'mean' metric, mean negative log base 10 p-value top term TF get_median bool whether get 'median' metric, median negative log base 10 p-value top term TF get_annotation_overlap bool whether get 'annotation_overlap' metric, percent TFs annotated GO term target genes enriched go_ann data.frame annotations genes GO terms. Obtain WebGestaltR::loadGeneSet. go_reg data.frame regulatory relationships GO terms. Obtain ontologyIndex::get_ontology.

title: get_terms — get_terms
text: Get enrichment data top n terms TF summary file folder output webgestalt_network function.

title: get_terms — get_terms
text: path folder containing .csv files enrichment summaries output webgestalt_network n number terms summary get data

title: plot_metrics — plot_metrics
text: Plot summary metrics get_metrics across network subset size one networks.

title: plot_metrics — plot_metrics
code: plot_metrics(   metric_dfs_by_net,   title_text,   subtitle_text,   sum = TRUE,   percent = FALSE,   mean = FALSE,   median = FALSE,   annotation_overlap = TRUE )

title: plot_metrics — plot_metrics
text: metric_dfs_by_net list outputs get_metrics network plotted title_text text title plot; generally names networks subtitle_text text subtitle plot sum bool whether plot 'sum' metric, sum negative log base 10 p-value top term TF minus 3 times total number TFs. percent bool whether plot 'percent' metric, percent TFs least one GO term FDR < 0.05 mean bool whether plot 'mean' metric, mean negative log base 10 p-value top term TF median bool whether plot 'median' metric, median negative log base 10 p-value top term TF annotation_overlap bool whether plot 'annotation_overlap' metric, percent TFs annotated GO term target genes enriched

title: subset_network — subset_network
text: network edge scores, create subsets using top given numbers edges. input file tab-separated three columns: TFs, regulated genes, scores. output files tab-separated two columns: TFs, regulated genes.

title: subset_network — subset_network
text: input_file folder containing .csv files enrichment summaries output webgestalt_network output_folder name folder place created network subset files name base name created network subset files edges list numbers edges average edges per TF include subset perTF boolean TRUE elements "edges" represent average edges per TF subsets FALSE represent total number edges

title: webgestalt_network — webgestalt_network
text: Given network network subset, webgestalt_network generate ORA results network given number permutations. NOTE: using output_directory network_name different network , must first delete contents "/webgestalt_work/network_name/"

title: webgestalt_network — webgestalt_network
code: webgestalt_network(   network_path,   reference_set,   output_directory,   network_name,   organism = "hsapiens",   database = "geneontology_Biological_Process_noRedundant",   permutations = 10 )

title: webgestalt_network — webgestalt_network
text: network_path path network network subset evaluate. Must tab-separated file first column TFs second column regulated genes. reference_set path set genes possibly included network. Must file containing exactly one column genes possibly appear network. output_directory path folder output networks subset original network stored network_name name folder store results within output_directory. now, best format "{name}_{# edges}" like "example_8". organism human: "hsapiens"; yeast: "scerevisiae" database gene set database search enrichment - see options WebGestaltR::listGeneSet() permutations number randomly permuted networks create run ORA
